3-mathematics-data-and-probability-stati.title: Bar/Line Plots
3-mathematics-data-and-probability-stati.description: Master Bar/Line Plots concepts and skills.

questions.prompt: A bar plot shows pets: Dogs 8, Cats 6, Rabbits 4. How many pets total?

options.feedback: Not quite. Add all three numbers.

questions.explanation: Add all values from the bar plot.

questions.prompt: A line plot shows: X X X at 2, X X at 3, X X X X at 4. Which value has the most marks?

options.feedback: Correct! There are four X marks at 4.

questions.explanation: Count the X marks at each value and find the highest count.

questions.prompt: A sports team's weekly goals: Mon 3, Tue 5, Wed 4, Thu 6. How many more goals on Thursday than Monday?

options.feedback: That's the sum, not the difference.

questions.explanation: Find the difference: Thursday goals (6) - Monday goals (3) = 3.

questions.prompt: A bar plot shows test scores: 85, 90, 85, 95. How many students scored 85?
questions.explanation: Count how many times 85 appears in the data.

questions.prompt: A flower's height measurements in inches: 4, 5, 5, 6, 6, 6. How many flowers are 6 inches tall?

options.feedback: That's one of the measurements, not the count.

questions.explanation: Count the occurrences of the value 6.

questions.prompt: A restaurant served meals daily: Mon 45, Tue 50, Wed 48, Thu 52, Fri 60. On which day were the fewest meals served?
questions.explanation: Find the smallest value in the plot.

questions.prompt: A line plot shows book pages read: 10, 15, 15, 20, 20, 20, 25. What is the total pages read?

3-mathematics-data-and-probability-stati.title: Interpreting Tables/Charts
3-mathematics-data-and-probability-stati.description: Master Interpreting Tables/Charts concepts and skills.

questions.prompt: A table shows fruit prices: Apple $2, Orange $3, Banana $1. How much is an apple?
questions.explanation: Find the apple row and read its price.

questions.prompt: A chart shows: Jane 15, Tom 18, Lisa 16. Who scored the most?
A table shows: Red 12, Blue 8, Green 10. How many more red than blue?
A table: Monday temp 72°F, Tuesday temp 75°F, Wednesday temp 70°F. What was Wednesday's temperature?
questions.explanation: Find the Wednesday row and read the temperature.

questions.prompt: A table shows animals: Dogs 9, Cats 7, Birds 5, Fish 6. How many dogs and cats total?

options.feedback: Not quite. Add dogs and cats.

questions.prompt: A table shows ages: Emma 10, Leo 12, Sophia 11, Marcus 10. How many children are 10 years old?

options.feedback: Correct! Emma and Marcus are both 10.

questions.explanation: Count how many entries show age 10.

questions.prompt: A sales table: Week 1 $100, Week 2 $150, Week 3 $120, Week 4 $180. Which week had the most sales?

options.feedback: Week 2 had $150, but Week 4 had more.

3-mathematics-data-and-probability-stati.title: Intro Probability (experimental)
3-mathematics-data-and-probability-stati.description: Master Intro Probability (experimental) concepts and skills.

questions.prompt: A coin is flipped 10 times: 6 heads, 4 tails. How many heads?
questions.explanation: Count the heads from the experiment.

questions.prompt: A spinner lands on red 8 times and blue 12 times out of 20 spins. How many times did it land on blue?
questions.explanation: Look at the blue results from the experiment.

questions.prompt: Rolling a die 30 times: 1 landed 5 times, 2 landed 4 times, 3 landed 6 times. How many times did 3 appear?
Drawing cards 20 times: Red 11 times, Black 9 times. How many draws were there?
questions.explanation: Add the red and black draws to get the total.

questions.prompt: An experiment with a bag of marbles (100 draws): Yellow 35 times, Green 25 times, Blue 40 times. How many blue draws?
questions.explanation: Find the count for blue in the experiment.

questions.prompt: A number cube rolled 24 times: 1 appeared 3 times, 2 appeared 4 times, 3 appeared 6 times, 4 appeared 5 times, 5 appeared 3 times, 6 appeared 3 times. Which number appeared most?
questions.explanation: Compare the frequencies to find the highest count.

questions.prompt: In an experiment with 50 coin flips, heads appeared 28 times. How many times did tails appear?
A coin is flipped 10 times: 6 heads, 4 tails. How many heads?
questions.explanation: Count the heads from the experiment.

questions.prompt: A spinner lands on red 8 times and blue 12 times out of 20 spins. How many times did it land on blue?
questions.explanation: Look at the blue results from the experiment.

questions.prompt: Rolling a die 30 times: 1 landed 5 times, 2 landed 4 times, 3 landed 6 times. How many times did 3 appear?
Drawing cards 20 times: Red 11 times, Black 9 times. How many draws were there?
questions.explanation: Add the red and black draws to get the total.

questions.prompt: An experiment with a bag of marbles (100 draws): Yellow 35 times, Green 25 times, Blue 40 times. How many blue draws?
questions.explanation: Find the count for blue in the experiment.

questions.prompt: A number cube rolled 24 times: 1 appeared 3 times, 2 appeared 4 times, 3 appeared 6 times, 4 appeared 5 times, 5 appeared 3 times, 6 appeared 3 times. Which number appeared most?
questions.explanation: Compare the frequencies to find the highest count.

questions.prompt: In an experiment with 50 coin flips, heads appeared 28 times. How many times did tails appear?

3-mathematics-geometry-and-measurement-a.title: Angles & Lines
3-mathematics-geometry-and-measurement-a.description: Master Angles & Lines concepts and skills.

questions.prompt: What do two rays sharing an endpoint form?
questions.explanation: Two rays with a common endpoint form an angle.

questions.prompt: A right angle measures how many degrees?
Perpendicular lines meet at what angle?
An acute angle is less than how many degrees?
questions.explanation: Acute angles measure less than 90 degrees.

questions.prompt: An obtuse angle is between 90° and 180°?

options.feedback: Obtuse angles always fit this range.

questions.explanation: Obtuse angles are larger than 90° but smaller than 180°.

questions.prompt: Parallel lines never meet and form what kind of angle?
A straight line forms an angle of how many degrees?
A rectangle is 5 units long and 3 units wide. What is its perimeter?
A rectangle is 4 cm long and 3 cm wide. What is its area?
A square has sides of 5 inches. What is its perimeter?
A square has sides of 6 meters. What is its area?
questions.explanation: Area of square = side × side = 6 × 6 = 36 m².

questions.prompt: A rectangle has length 10 cm and width 2 cm. What is its area?

options.feedback: That's the perimeter with wrong units.

questions.prompt: A garden is rectangular, 8 yards by 6 yards. How much fencing is needed?
Find the perimeter of a triangle with sides 3, 4, and 5 units.

options.feedback: Not quite. Add all three sides.

6-mathematics-data-and-probability-stati.title: Probability Rules
6-mathematics-data-and-probability-stati.description: Master Probability Rules concepts and skills.

questions.prompt: A coin is flipped 10 times: 6 heads, 4 tails. How many heads?
questions.explanation: Count the heads from the experiment.

questions.prompt: A spinner lands on red 8 times and blue 12 times out of 20 spins. How many times did it land on blue?
questions.explanation: Look at the blue results from the experiment.

questions.prompt: Rolling a die 30 times: 1 landed 5 times, 2 landed 4 times, 3 landed 6 times. How many times did 3 appear?
Drawing cards 20 times: Red 11 times, Black 9 times. How many draws were there?
questions.explanation: Add the red and black draws to get the total.

questions.prompt: An experiment with a bag of marbles (100 draws): Yellow 35 times, Green 25 times, Blue 40 times. How many blue draws?
questions.explanation: Find the count for blue in the experiment.

questions.prompt: A number cube rolled 24 times: 1 appeared 3 times, 2 appeared 4 times, 3 appeared 6 times, 4 appeared 5 times, 5 appeared 3 times, 6 appeared 3 times. Which number appeared most?
questions.explanation: Compare the frequencies to find the highest count.

questions.prompt: In an experiment with 50 coin flips, heads appeared 28 times. How many times did tails appear?
